problem.p: If an upward force is applied to the truss instead of a downward force (as shown by the black arrows), do you expect the bottom chord/member of a truss (shown in green) to be in tension, compression, or both tension and compression?

choicegroup.label: If an upward force is applied to the truss instead of a downward force (as shown by the black arrows), do you expect the bottom chord/member of a truss (shown in green) to be in tension, compression, or both tension and compression?

div.p: Under this loading condition the bottom of the truss will be in compression as it will shorten. The top chord/member of the truss will elongate, thus will be in tension.
